TITLE I--YOSEMITE NATIONAL PARK AUTHORIZED PAYMENTS

Sec. 102. Payments for educational services.
Sec. 103. Authorization for park facilities outside Yosemite National Park boundaries. For fiscal years 2006 through 2009, the Secretary of the Interior may provide funds to California school districts for educational services to students who are dependents of Yosemite National Park personnel or live near the park on US-owned property. The Secretary's authority to make payments will end if California or local agencies do not maintain funding levels. Payments are restricted to paying public employees for educational services. Payments under this section are limited to $400,000 per fiscal year or the amount needed for educational services for students in California. The funds come from the National Park Service's appropriations, donations, or fees, excluding certain sources. Payments under this section are authorized for various purposes, including entrance or use fees at National Park System units, emergency appropriations for flood recovery at Yosemite National Park, and funding sources available to Yosemite National Park. Payments under this section are authorized for various purposes, including entrance or use fees at National Park System units, emergency appropriations for flood recovery at Yosemite National Park, and funding sources available to Yosemite National Park. It is the sense of Congress that any payments made under this section should not result in a reduction of funds to Yosemite National Park from any specific funding source, and that funding levels should reflect annual increases in the park's operating base funds. SEC. 102. AUTHORIZATION FOR PARK FACILITIES OUTSIDE YOSEMITE NATIONAL PARK BOUNDARIES. Funding authority for transportation systems and external facilities in national parks, including Yosemite National Park, is amended to clarify funding sources and fee authority for transportation services. Amendments include specifying funding for transportation systems, not just facilities, and expanding fee authority to include cooperative agreements. The funding authority for transportation systems in national parks, including Yosemite National Park, is amended to clarify funding sources and fee authority for transportation services by inserting "service contract, cooperative agreement, or other contractual arrangement". TITLE II--Rancho Corral de Tierra Golden Gate National Recreation Area Boundary Adjustment Act. The Rancho Corral de Tierra Golden Gate National Recreation Area Boundary Adjustment Act amends Section 2(a) of Public Law 92-589 by including additional lands in the recreation area, as specified by the Assessor of Marin County, California. The Golden Gate National Recreation Area includes lands in San Mateo County, acquired under various acts, and depicted on specific maps. The Golden Gate National Recreation Area, NPS-80,079E, dated March 2004, allows the Secretary to acquire land only from willing sellers.
